body_html:
This thread has been GOLD.

I found that I was literally fixing some of the same errors you guys were finding at the same time on my own. After discovering this thread, every single time I ran into something, it had been discussed here. So Kudos to all involved. (PyTorch - Can we PLEASE get a Windows version? It's only like 80% of the market... :) )

Using the trials in this page, I have successfully compiled pyTorch for Windows and can compile my extensions.

However, now that I run it, I get this annoying error:

Overall Progress:   0%|                                                   | 0/10000 [00:00<?, ?it/s]

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 550, in <module>
    validation_loss, iterations = train(args=args, epoch=epoch - 1, start_iteration=global_iteration, data_loader=validation_loader, model=model_and_loss, optimizer=optimizer, logger=validation_logger, is_validate=True, offset=offset)
  File "main.py", line 53, in train
    progress = tqdm(tools.IteratorTimer(data_loader), ncols=100, total=np.minimum(len(data_loader), args.render_n_batches), leave=True, position=offset, desc=title, file=sys.stdout)
  File "E:\p4\Project\utility\tools.py", line 256, in __init__
    self.iterator = self.iterable.__iter__()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 310, in __iter__
    return DataLoaderIter(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 167, in __init__
    w.start()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\process.py", line 105, in start
    self._popen = self._Popen(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 223, in _Popen
    return _default_context.get_context().Process._Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 322, in _Popen
    return Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\popen_spawn_win32.py", line 65, in __init__
    reduction.dump(process_obj, to_child)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\reduction.py", line 60, in dump
    ForkingPickler(file, protocol).dump(obj)
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

The main.py is wrapped in if __name__ == "__main__": as has been suggested.

I also have tried to set number_workers to 0, 1, 4, 40, with no result. Setting it to 0 just has python crash. Setting it to anything above 0 creates the error above.

I feel like I'm running out of road on getting a windows version of this going...
body_text:
This thread has been GOLD.
I found that I was literally fixing some of the same errors you guys were finding at the same time on my own.  After discovering this thread, every single time I ran into something, it had been discussed here.  So Kudos to all involved.  (PyTorch - Can we PLEASE get a Windows version?  It's only like 80% of the market... :) )
Using the trials in this page, I have successfully compiled pyTorch for Windows and can compile my extensions.
However, now that I run it, I get this annoying error:
Overall Progress:   0%|                                                   | 0/10000 [00:00<?, ?it/s]

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 550, in <module>
    validation_loss, iterations = train(args=args, epoch=epoch - 1, start_iteration=global_iteration, data_loader=validation_loader, model=model_and_loss, optimizer=optimizer, logger=validation_logger, is_validate=True, offset=offset)
  File "main.py", line 53, in train
    progress = tqdm(tools.IteratorTimer(data_loader), ncols=100, total=np.minimum(len(data_loader), args.render_n_batches), leave=True, position=offset, desc=title, file=sys.stdout)
  File "E:\p4\Project\utility\tools.py", line 256, in __init__
    self.iterator = self.iterable.__iter__()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 310, in __iter__
    return DataLoaderIter(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 167, in __init__
    w.start()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\process.py", line 105, in start
    self._popen = self._Popen(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 223, in _Popen
    return _default_context.get_context().Process._Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 322, in _Popen
    return Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\popen_spawn_win32.py", line 65, in __init__
    reduction.dump(process_obj, to_child)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\reduction.py", line 60, in dump
    ForkingPickler(file, protocol).dump(obj)
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

The main.py is wrapped in if __name__ == "__main__": as has been suggested.
I also have tried to set number_workers to 0, 1, 4, 40, with no result.  Setting it to 0 just has python crash.  Setting it to anything above 0 creates the error above.
I feel like I'm running out of road on getting a windows version of this going...
body:
This thread has been GOLD. 

I found that I was literally fixing some of the same errors you guys were finding at the same time on my own.  After discovering this thread, every single time I ran into something, it had been discussed here.  So Kudos to all involved.  (PyTorch - Can we PLEASE get a Windows version?  It's only like 80% of the market... :) )

Using the trials in this page, I have successfully compiled pyTorch for Windows and can compile my extensions.  

However, now that I run it, I get this annoying error:

```
Overall Progress:   0%|                                                   | 0/10000 [00:00<?, ?it/s]

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 550, in <module>
    validation_loss, iterations = train(args=args, epoch=epoch - 1, start_iteration=global_iteration, data_loader=validation_loader, model=model_and_loss, optimizer=optimizer, logger=validation_logger, is_validate=True, offset=offset)
  File "main.py", line 53, in train
    progress = tqdm(tools.IteratorTimer(data_loader), ncols=100, total=np.minimum(len(data_loader), args.render_n_batches), leave=True, position=offset, desc=title, file=sys.stdout)
  File "E:\p4\Project\utility\tools.py", line 256, in __init__
    self.iterator = self.iterable.__iter__()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 310, in __iter__
    return DataLoaderIter(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 167, in __init__
    w.start()
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\process.py", line 105, in start
    self._popen = self._Popen(self)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 223, in _Popen
    return _default_context.get_context().Process._Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\context.py", line 322, in _Popen
    return Popen(process_obj)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\popen_spawn_win32.py", line 65, in __init__
    reduction.dump(process_obj, to_child)
  File "C:\Miniconda2\envs\pytorch\lib\multiprocessing\reduction.py", line 60, in dump
    ForkingPickler(file, protocol).dump(obj)
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
```

The main.py is wrapped in `if __name__ == "__main__":` as has been suggested.

I also have tried to set number_workers to 0, 1, 4, 40, with no result.  Setting it to 0 just has python crash.  Setting it to anything above 0 creates the error above.

I feel like I'm running out of road on getting a windows version of this going...
